comments.body: Probably just my ignorance about `Inside` but this match doesn't seem exhaustive and, if so, what (failure, hopefully) message do we get in other cases?
Alright, it stringifies the whole value, which should be fine, thanks for checking and sorry for the laziness üëçüèº
üëç I don't like the fact that this is not capture in the scaladocs themselves, had to dive into the source code to figure it out
Sadly, it often happens with Scala libs.
